pollutantsPage.title: What Does Each Pollutant Measure?
pollutantsPage.subtitle: A quick guide to interpreting the map and satellite values (TEMPO).

no2.label: Nitrogen Dioxide
no2.sources: Traffic, power plants, fossil fuel combustion.
no2.risks: Irritation and asthma aggravation; ozone precursor.
no2.tips: Lower mobile emissions; avoid intense exercise during peaks.

so2.label: Sulfur Dioxide
so2.risks: Respiratory irritation; acid rain; vegetation damage.

o3.label: Tropospheric Ozone
o3.sources: Photochemically formed from NOx + VOCs; regional transport.
o3.tips: Reduce NOx/VOCs; avoid outdoors during peaks; follow alerts.

hcho.label: Formaldehyde
hcho.risks: Irritation; contributes to tropospheric ozone formation.

tempoPage.title: TEMPO Satellite: The Air Quality Revolution
tempoPage.subtitle: The Tropospheric Emissions: Monitoring of Pollution (TEMPO) mission is changing how we see the air we breathe.
tempoPage.description: Prior to TEMPO, air quality data from space was available only once a day. TEMPO breaks this barrier by being mounted on a commercial communications satellite in a geostationary orbit. This revolutionary positioning allows it to stare continuously at the same large area (North America), capturing hourly snapshots of pollution during the entire day. This level of detail is critical for understanding pollution sources, forecasting air quality, and protecting public health across the continent.

geostationary.title: GEOSTATIONARY ORBIT
geostationary.description: TEMPO is the first instrument to measure air quality from a geostationary orbit, allowing for continuous, hourly coverage over North America.

fullContinental.title: FULL CONTINENTAL VIEW
fullContinental.description: It monitors the atmosphere from the Atlantic to the Pacific and from the tropics to the middle of Canada, providing a massive dataset.

hourlyData.title: HOURLY DATA RESOLUTION
hourlyData.description: The mission provides near-real-time data, offering hourly updates during the daytime to track rapid changes in pollution.
